Here are 4 meetings that high-impact leaders 
run on repeat:

1. Daily Check-In (5 minutes)
↳ Quick sync. Stand up. Share priorities.
↳ Skip the small talk, this is your rhythm reset.
↳ Run it even if a few folks miss it.

2. Weekly Tactical (45–90 minutes)
↳ Turn updates into traction.
↳ Name what’s stuck. Celebrate what moved.
↳ Start with metrics. Then solve, don’t spiral.

3. Monthly Strategic (2–4 hours)
↳ Zoom out. Think long-term.
↳ Ask better questions. Make smarter bets.
↳ Pick 1–2 topics. Reflect. Decide with clarity.

4. Quarterly Offsite (1–2 days)
↳ New space. Bigger vision.
↳ Get off Zoom. Clear the whiteboard.
↳ Focus on team health and bold direction.

Meetings aren’t a distraction from leadership.
They are leadership.

The truth? 

You don’t need more meetings.
You need better ones.

Start with these 4.

Use them to coach, not just coordinate.
That’s how real leaders build momentum.

♻️ Repost to help someone lead better today.
📌 Follow ‏Kavit Haria‏ for simple wins in
coaching, leadership, and business.

If you want to lead a high-performing team,
you need to shield them from a toxic culture.

Or better yet, don't let it happen in the first place.

Little can undo the damage of chronic overwork,
unrealistic expectations, and an uncertain career path.

As a leader, you have a significant impact on your
employees’ lives, inside and outside the workplace.

Create a culture where high performance
doesn’t equate to grinding your people down.

Rather than providing meditation & therapy apps,
ensure your people feel seen, heard, and appreciated.

Your employees are products of their environment.
So, make sure they’re in the right one.

How to build real browser automation.

(With open-source control and 5x lower cost.)

Most AI agents stop at reading websites.

They analyze content, extract data, and generate insights.

But when it comes to clicking buttons, filling forms, or navigating like a human?

They fall short.

The problem with current web automation:

→ Expensive proprietary tools ($50+ per task)
→ Black-box systems you can't customize
→ API-only access that breaks on dynamic sites
→ Requires expensive models to function properly

SurferH-CLI solves this problem completely.

It's the first open-source web agent that actually controls Chrome browsers end-to-end.

Here's what makes it different:

→ Runs locally on your own Chrome browser
→ Actually clicks, scrolls, types, and navigates like humans
→ Works with any VLM (GPT-4o, Gemini 1.5) via OpenAI SDK
→ Fully open-source (Apache 2.0) - copy it, modify it, use it anywhere.
→ Achieves 92.2% success on WebVoyager benchmark
→ Costs just $0.13 per task (5× cheaper than alternatives)
→ No black-box SaaS - full control and transparency

• No more API limitations.
• No more proprietary lock-in.
• No more expensive per-task pricing.

With SurferH-CLI + Holo-1 (their open-source 3B parameter model) 
↳ You get state-of-the-art performance at a fraction of the cost.

Perfect for:
→ Developers building automation tools
→ Researchers testing real-world agents
→ Anyone wanting real browser control

This isn't just another AI demo.

It's production-ready automation you can actually use.

🎉 30 Years of Deutsche Telekom! 🎉

500 guests, classical and modern music, sports, politics, two grand pianos (in Bonn and Hamburg) coming together for a piece of music, and an elephant. Yesterday, we kicked off the celebrations for the 30th anniversary of Telekom with a festive event. We celebrated ourselves, and we were also celebrated a little: 200,000 Telekom employees worldwide.

Who would have thought that the authority called Telekom would once become a modern company? Growing from 37 million to over 300 million customers worldwide? Increasing revenue from 34 billion to 116 billion euros? And rising from number six to the most valuable telecom company in Europe?

Our journey has been one of transformation and design. It has been about decision-making and action. But above all, it has been about people. Like Ron Sommer, who visionary opened up new markets. Or Kai-Uwe Ricke, who took Telekom out of debt and made new investments possible. Or my friend René Obermann, who, like no one else, put our customers at the center of our operations. Most importantly, it has been the many Telekom employees who are with us today or who once were. Those who never gave up. Those who continually reinvented themselves and our company, even in the face of headwinds. Change has also left wounds. That is part of our history.

Birthdays certainly evoke nostalgia and reflection. But not reflection that keeps us stagnant. Instead, reflection that serves as motivation. We, too, must reinvent Telekom every day. AI represents a significant revolution. If we use it wisely, we will become even more efficient, customer-oriented, and faster. Hopefully: unbeatable.

My highlight yesterday was the unveiling of the "Gran elephant dret" by Miquel Barceló. It symbolically represents what Telekom stands for: It is no longer "gray and sluggish." Instead, it is colorful and agile, curious and playful. The elephant that now stands in front of the Telekom headquarters should remind us to "Think again!" It embodies the power of change and the courage to continually reinvent the future. Those who understand the art of making the impossible possible can also achieve remarkable feats.

Thank you to our guests, the Beethoven Orchestra with Dirk Kaftan, Walter Smerling from the Kunst und Kultur Foundation, Mayor Katja Dörner, Prime Minister (NRW) Hendrik Wüst, Digital Minister Karsten Wildberger, Minister Nathanael Liminski, Philipp Schindera , and everyone who contributed to the success of our festive event.

The "T" in the Deutsche Telekom logo will also continue to stand for transformation and technology, but also for trust and teamwork. And recently also for Törrööö!

#DeutscheTelekom #30Years #Innovation #Transformation #ConnectingYourWorld

McDonald's trusted an AI chatbot with 64 million job applications. Hackers needed just six keystrokes to access them all.

➡️ I've seen plenty of security failures, but this one takes the McFlurry. Security researchers just exposed how McDonald's AI hiring platform left millions of job seekers' data vulnerable—protected by a password that would embarrass a middle schooler: '123456'.

➡️ The platform, built by Paradox.ai, features an AI chatbot named Olivia that screens applicants through McHire.com. Researchers Ian Carroll and Sam Curry discovered they could access 64 million application records simply by guessing administrator credentials. 

➡️ No multifactor authentication. No security checks. Just instant access to names, emails, phone numbers—everything applicants shared while desperately trying to explain their job experience to a confused chatbot.

➡️ The breach reveals a darker pattern in our rush to automate everything. We're handing over sensitive human moments, like job applications, to AI systems secured with less care than your Netflix account.This incident crystallizes three uncomfortable truths about our AI-powered future:

👉 Companies deploy AI for efficiency but forget basic security fundamentals
👉 The most vulnerable data often belongs to those seeking entry-level work
👉 Human oversight remains critical when machines handle human dignity

❓ When we delegate human processes to machines, we inherit new responsibilities, not shed them.  As we accelerate toward AI-mediated everything, here's my question: Should companies be required to match their security investment to their automation ambitions?

Read the full article on WIRED: https://lnkd.in/g8sB7xnT

#Cybersecurity #AIEthics #DataBreach #FutureOfWork #Privacy #Automation

lemlist recently crossed $34,000,000 ARR.

Here's every tool they use to run their SaaS:

Their CEO, Charles Tenot, was kind enough to share their entire tech stack ↓


1️⃣ Content 

Their team has a combined 300,000+ LinkedIn follower count.

This includes their Founder Guillaume's account (23,000+ followers), their CEO Charles (29,000+) and other teammates such as Kévin (78,000+), Lucas (57,000+), Tal (34,000+), Erwan (32,000+) & others.

They use:

- Taplio, their own platform, for content planning, ideation, and analytics.
- Figma to design infographics & carousels.

They drive 200,000+ visitors to their site every month. For SEO, they use:

- Google Search Console to monitor their website's organic performance.
- Ahrefs & Semrush to research keywords & monitor rankings.
- Storyblok as their content management system (CMS).


2️⃣ Outbound

Since their main product, lemlist, is an all-in-one prospecting platform, it's also the tool they use most for outbound.

On top of that, they source data from several platforms:

- B2B databases: People Data Labs, Apollo, lemlist.
- Technology data: BuiltWith
- Funding data: Crunchbase

For Data enrichment, their platform includes a waterfall with the best email finders on the market (incl. Prospeo.io).

They also use a few intent signal platforms:

- LoneScale to monitor new job openings, job changes & new hires.
- Snitcher for website visitor identification.
- G2 for SaaS buyers' intent.

For 'complex' data use-cases (niche data sourcing, deep ai agentic research), they use Clay.

For deliverability, they use their email warmup platform, lemwarm.

They leverage AI models like OpenAI, Claude, Mistral AI, and use Dust, an AI agent builder.


3️⃣ Product

They use a few software for production data, including:

- BigQuery as their data warehouse.
- Google Cloud to deploy applications.
- Holistics Data as a business intelligence platform for analytics.
- RudderStack & dbt Labs as customer data platform for data transformation.

For prototyping, they use:

- Vercel V0 for code generation & user interface.
- Replit to develop & deploy software.


4️⃣ Funnel

They convert around ~7-8% of their 200K+ monthly visits into signups. This amounts to 15,000+ new signups every month.

To track product/website metrics, they use:
- Mixpanel
- Google Analytics

To extract, transform, load & synchronise data across every department, they use Hightouch, which is what's called a 'reverse ETL platform'.

Then, their marketing stack includes:
- Customer.io (for email marketing)
- Default (for lead routing)
- Webflow (website)


5️⃣ Sales

Their sales team, led by Yann Guilleux, has been on fire lately.

We're talking $685K in ARR closed last month.

Their sales stack includes:
- Hyperline for contracts, custom quotes, invoicing.
- Spoke for meetings recordings/transcripts.
- lemcal to schedule meetings.
- HubSpot as their CRM.

I'm running out of space given the number of tools, haha!

What if the real disruption in manufacturing isn’t coming from AI, cloud, or automation... but from the uncomfortable realization that we’ve been investing in all the wrong things?

According to Deloitte’s 2025 Smart Manufacturing Survey, manufacturers are pouring billions into tech. 𝟕𝟖% are allocating over 𝟐𝟎% of their improvement budgets to smart manufacturing. 𝟒𝟔% are prioritizing process automation. 
The intent is clear. 
The excitement is real. 

But…. I would argue 𝐰𝐞’𝐫𝐞 𝐬𝐭𝐢𝐥𝐥 𝐧𝐨𝐭 𝐫𝐞𝐚𝐝𝐲..
Not in our culture. 
Not in our org structures. 
Not in how we prepare our people.

The data exposes the gap. Human capital is the least mature capability in the smart manufacturing stack. Only 𝟒𝟖% of companies have a training and adoption standard. Yet it’s the number one area they say they want to improve. And while 𝟖𝟓% believe smart manufacturing will attract new talent, more than a third say their biggest human capital concern is simply adapting workers to the factory of the future.

We like the sound of digital transformation as long as it doesn't slow us down. We like the optics of AI as long as we don't have to redesign how we work. We like talking about the workforce of the future as long as we don’t have to train the one we already have.

So yes, investment is rising. But if we don’t confront the outdated systems and assumptions holding us back, all we’re doing is layering expensive tech on fragile foundations.

The biggest barrier to smart manufacturing isn’t budget, technology, or even talent.

It’s us.

Here are 8 practical phrases that helped me set boundaries and reclaim my confidence:

1️⃣ When they try to guilt you: 
"I understand how you feel, but I’m confident in my decision."

2️⃣ When they dismiss your feelings: 
"My feelings are valid, and I’d appreciate it if you respected them."

3️⃣ When they constantly criticize you: 
"I welcome constructive feedback, but this doesn’t feel helpful."

4️⃣ When they play the victim: 
"I hear what you’re going through, but I can’t take responsibility for this."

5️⃣ When they spread negativity: 
"Let’s focus on what we can control and improve."

6️⃣ When they gaslight you: 
"I know my experience, and this is how I see it."

7️⃣ When they try to control the situation: 
"I understand your perspective, but I need to make my own decisions."

8️⃣ When they interrupt you: 
"I’d appreciate it if I could finish speaking before you share your thoughts."

You’re not responsible for fixing toxic people.

But you are responsible for protecting 
your energy, your values, and your peace.

Speak up. 
Stand firm.

Every boundary you set teaches others how to treat you.

🔁 Repost if this reminder was something you needed today.

✔️Here is detailed information about the Arduino Uno:

Overview:

The Arduino Uno is a microcontroller board based on the ATmega328P. It is one of the most popular boards in the Arduino family. ideal for beginners and hobbyists.

Pin Diagram Explanation:

1. Digital Pins (0-13): For input/output operations (like reading switches. controlling LEDs).

2. Analog Pins (A0-A5): Read analog sensors like temperature or light.

3. PWM Pins (3.5.6. 9. 10. 11): Provide Pulse Width Modulation for dimming LEDs or controlling motors.

4. TX (1) and RX (0): Used for serial communication.

5. Power Pins:

Vin: Input voltage.

5V/3.3V: Output regulated voltage.

GND: Ground.

AREF: Analog Reference voltage.

Communication Options:

Serial (UART)

I2C (A4-SDA. A5 SCL)

SPI (Pins 10 SS. 11 MOSI. 12 - MISO. 13-SCK)

GND: Ground.

AREF: Analog Reference voltage.

Programming the Board:

Use Arduino IDE (available for Windows. macOS. Linux).

Select Board: Arduino Uno and correct COM port.

Upload code via USB using standard A-B USB cable.

 Common Uses:

LED & buzzer control

Sensor interfacing

Robotics

Home automation

IoT (with WiFi modules)

Educational electronics

Advantages:

Easy to use and program

Extensive documentation and community support

Open-source hardware

Compatible with many shields

Leader’s perspectives I "AI at Work: Transforming with Deloitte, SAP and AWS"

@Netra Saxena, Associate Director, Deloitte India, spoke passionately about how AI can be applied to real business processes, not just as a concept but as a value-driving engine across industries. She shared how these AI solutions are delivered using SAP BTP and how they can be seamlessly lifted and shifted to other hyperscalers to align with clients’ infrastructure preferences. A highlight of the session was the introduction of a new platform offering, AgentX, which enables end-to-end business process orchestration powered by Agentic AI. With AgentX, organisations can move beyond traditional automation and empower digital agents to reason, act and collaborate across systems.

Real use cases showcased:
• Smart reporting: Build real-time, on-demand reports with embedded insights, removing the dependency on static dashboards or BI teams.
• Intelligent invoicing: Automate the extraction of invoice details from documents and trigger direct posting into ERP systems with validation checks, reducing cycle time and manual effort.
• Concept to case: Turn ideas into structured business cases using GenAI, instantly capturing problem statements, benefits, dependencies and ROI narratives.

Together, these solutions show how AI is already delivering measurable results, helping organisations drive efficiency, agility and long-term strategic impact.

Vinay Prabhakar, Hemendra Upadhyay, Mazhar Khan, Pankaj Banarase, Anand Rajagopalan, Deepak Kagliwal, Rahul  Venkateshwaran, @Suja Savio, Gopinath Padhi, Manas Ketkar CA PMP, Hemant Kumar Dua, Satyam Jha

#DeloitteIndia #AIatWork  #MigrateX #AIERP #ERPTransformation #AITransformation #AlliancesSpotlight

A significant step forward — and one we’ve been preparing for.
I’m proud to officially announce that M&I Systems Co. has acquired IT company NPS, previously majority-owned by Saga Beograd, part of the global Noventiq group.

NPS is recognized as one of the most reputable partners in Serbia in the implementation and maintenance of Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central (NAV) ERP systems. With over two decades of experience, it brings invaluable expertise in business consulting, ERP implementation, Business Intelligence (BI) solutions, as well as digital transformation and automation.

This acquisition marks an important milestone — our first joint transaction within the Seyfor Group — and it perfectly aligns with the growth strategy I’ve spoken about over the past year. The goal was always clear: identify and integrate strong, complementary companies that share our values and ambition.

This acquisition reinforces our commitment to expanding our capabilities and market reach. Over the past few months, we carefully analyzed the IT market and observed several potential acquisition targets. NPS stood out as a company with an optimal market share, healthy financials, and significant potential for further growth. 

There are considerable opportunities in the Southeast Europe market, and we will continue to evaluate and identify target companies for our further market expansion, the ones that align with our company culture, products, and services, ensuring they are fit for our strategic development in the future.

We are excited about what lies ahead, and we’re even more excited to welcome our new colleagues from NPS.

Welcome aboard!

Big news to share: Praxis Labs has been acquired by Torch!

When Elise Smith and I first met 7 years ago, we connected on the basis that workplaces are not set up for all of us to succeed. And that we needed more human-centered and inclusive leaders to engage diverse perspectives, build resilient teams, and create better products and services for us all. 

I am forever grateful for that first coffee date, and the email that Elise sent the entire eng listserve (I see you GSB students emailing Stanford eng 👀) that sparked my interest. It was the start of our journey with Praxis Labs. While there have been many twists and turns – COVID, a bank run, politicization of DEI – the decision to believe in ourselves, in the potential for change, and in a better future is one of the best decisions I’ve made. 

Joining forces with Torch marks an exciting new chapter and opportunity. Praxis is built on the belief that real-world practice, personalized coaching, and concrete skills measurement can reshape how people learn, grow, and perform.  Heather Conklin immediately saw our vision and combined potential. With Torch, we’re able to connect human coaching and reflection with our technology to create a leadership intelligence platform that’s continuous, contextual, and connected to business priorities. That combination is how we help leaders — and systems — drive organizational transformation and sustained behavior change, at scale.

I’m incredibly proud of what we’ve built—and deeply grateful:
 👯 To the Praxis team, past and present: I’ve never worked with a group as diverse, quirky, passionate, and vibrant as you all.  Your brilliance, resilience, and heart fueled this journey, and I’m grateful to have made some lifelong friends through this. 
🤝 To our customers: Thank you for trusting two young women of color with some of the largest and most influential enterprises and for sharing our belief in a better way to learn and lead.
 🌱 And to our investors and advisors: You all have helped me grow and lead with purpose, and I am so grateful for your advice, partnership, and belief.

And enormous gratitude to Elise Smith, my cofounder and partner. We’ve been through many ups and downs in this journey – both personally and professionally – and thank you for being a constant source of vision, courage, and joy every step of the way.

I’ll be continuing this work as Head of AI Product at Torch, focused on how technology can expand access to transformative learning experiences. But today, I’m just feeling grateful—and excited for what’s ahead.

🔗 Full story linked in comments

Chobani is investing $500 million to expand our largest plant—creating space for 200+ new jobs and deepening our roots in the Magic Valley, where more than 1,000 Chobani team members already call home.

But growth is about more than buildings and equipment. It’s about people and potential.

That’s why we’re launching the Chobani Scholars Program at the College of Southern Idaho, in proud partnership with Governor Brad Little, his LAUNCH initiative, and College of Southern Idaho.

We had a great working session with Bobbi Stannard and Polly Hulsey, EdD to move this scholarship forward and help more local students access the education and support they need to build careers in food, agriculture, automation, and beyond—the very industries that keep our communities strong.

Because at Chobani, we believe opportunity should never be out of reach.

We’re proud to keep growing—with purpose, with partners, and with the people who make it all possible.

🔍 Want to enter the Semiconductor Industry but don’t know where to start?
Here’s a clear roadmap of the skills that can open doors to this high-impact, high-tech industry. 🧠⚡

Whether you're aiming for roles in VLSI design, fabrication, embedded systems, or testing, these are the must-have skills that recruiters are looking for:


🔧 Core Technical Skills:

✅ Digital Electronics – Combinational & sequential logic, FSMs, timing analysis
✅ Analog Electronics – Op-amps, filters, ADC/DAC, analog layout basics
✅ Semiconductor Physics – PN junctions, MOSFETs, CMOS tech, band theory
✅ VLSI Design – RTL design (Verilog/VHDL), synthesis, STA, DFT
✅ EDA Tools – Cadence, Synopsys, Mentor Graphics (Siemens)
✅ Scripting – Python, Shell, TCL (automation & flow scripting)
✅ Lab Skills – Oscilloscopes, signal generators, measurement equipment


🛠 Specialized Areas (Pick Your Path):

Front-End Design → RTL, IP/SoC, logic synthesis

Back-End Design → Physical Design, PnR, Floorplanning

DFT/Verification → SystemVerilog, UVM

Analog/Mixed Signal → Layout, SPICE simulations

Semiconductor Fabrication → Process engineering, lithography

Embedded/Systems → Microcontrollers, firmware, PCB design


📘 Soft Skills That Matter:

🗣 Communication & teamwork
🕰 Time management for tight tape-out cycles
🧩 Problem-solving and attention to detail


🌟 Bonus:

🔗 Certifications: NPTEL, VLSI System Design, Coursera
🧪 Projects: RTL to GDSII flow, SPI/I2C IP design, SoC integration
👨‍💼 Internships: Look for roles in fabs, design houses, or foundries


🔁 Like, Share, or Tag a friend who's passionate about semiconductors!

AI skills will be crucial for years to come. 


Great post by: Andrew Bolis


Original post below


⬇️⬇️⬇️


AI skills will be crucial for years to come. 

Knowing how to use ChatGPT isn’t enough. 

Learn these AI skills to future-proof your career: 

(remember to 🔖 save for later) 

1. Prompt Engineering:
Write better instructions to help AI tools give you exactly what you need.

2. AI Workflow Automation:
Link different apps together to help you complete tasks automatically.

3. AI Agents:
Use AI systems that act like teammates to handle tasks together.

4. Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG):
Link AI chatbots to your private files for more accurate answers.

5. Multimodal AI:
Use AI that understands pictures, sounds, and text all at once.

6. Fine-Tuning and AI Assistants:
Build custom AI models or assistants tailored to your needs.

7. Voice AI and Avatars:
Make realistic AI voices and avatars for videos and presentations.

8. AI Tool Stacking:
Use tools like Notion, Zapier, and ChatGPT together to work faster.

9. AI Video Content Generation:
Turn your ideas or blog posts into professional videos using AI.

10. SaaS Development:
Build small AI-powered apps using no-code tools.

11. LLM Management:
Keep track of how well your AI tools are working and what they cost.

12. Stay Updated:
Follow top AI news sites to stay ahead of trends and new tools.

AI won’t replace you. 
But someone with AI skills might."


------

Deploy AI agents like they’re part of your team. Follow AI Agent in Action for more ideas like this.

Everyone's building the same three AI products.

AI SDR. AI meeting notes. AI chatbot.

10,000 startups. 3 ideas. Zero taste.

I see pitch decks every week. "We're like Gong but with AI." "We're Salesforce with a chatbot." "We're the AI version of [insert any SaaS tool]."

Last week, a customer asked me for call recording features. I told him straight up:

"I am NOT a call recorder. You are offending me with these questions. I'm here to serve your customers."

He looked confused. Like I'd just told him I don't believe in gravity.

That's the problem. We're so obsessed with making AI do what humans used to do, we forgot to imagine what it could do that humans never could.

Take customer success. Everyone's racing to build AI that writes better follow-up emails. But what if the problem isn't the email quality? What if it's that we're sending emails at all?

What if instead of 10 touchpoints over 3 months, you could have one perfect interaction at exactly the right moment?

What if instead of quarterly business reviews, you had continuous intelligence flowing between you and your customer?

What if instead of "scaling" customer success, we reimagined it entirely?

This is what taste looks like in the AI era. Not copying what exists and adding a chatbot. But questioning every assumption about how business works.

The winners won't be the ones who build AI versions of old software. They'll be the ones who use AI to build things that were never possible before.

That's the difference between following and leading. Between copying and creating.

Between having taste and having none.

Stop building better note-takers. Start building better businesses.
